title: Special Mine Action Appeal 2012
description: The International Committee of the Red Cross (ICRC) Special Mine Action Appeal 2012 supports preventative mine action / weapons contamination programmes (including date gathering, mine risk reduction and education, surveys and clearance) and physical rehabilitation programmes. These activities contribute to international efforts to reduce the human cost of mines and other explosive remnants of war including by helping those affected restore their livelihoods and dignity. The objective of the initiative is to assist ICRC in implementing mine action around the world, including its focus on: promoting adherence to and full implementation of humanitarian law treaties designed to protect civilians from mines and other explosive remnants of war; engaging in humanitarian diplomacy to encourage governments and the public to address the problem of mines and other explosive remnants of war; implementing preventative mine-action activities to reduce mine/explosive remnants of war accidents to th
